intro: Oreodaphne gracilis, commonly known as the slender oreodaphne, is a species of flowering plant in the family Anacardiaceae. It is native to the tropical regions of Southeast Asia, including parts of Malaysia and Indonesia. The plant is characterized by its slender, erect stems and small, opposite leaves that are usually ovate to elliptic in shape. It produces small, yellowish-green flowers that are clustered in inflorescences, followed by small, round berries. Oreodaphne gracilis is often found in lowland and hill forest areas, growing in moist, shaded environments.
